articles.title: Kim Jong Il pays homage to President Kim Il Sung
National memorial service on 5th death anniversary  of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
National memorial service on 5th death anniversary  of Kim Il Sung
    Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- A national memorial service is held solemnly at the plaza of the Kumsusan Memorial Palace today, the 5th anniversary of the passing away of the President Kim Il Sung.   The service was attended by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.   Jo Myong Rok, first vice-chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and director of the general political department of the KPA, makes a memorial address at the service.

articles.title: National memorial service held in presence of Kim Jong Il
All Korean people observe three minutes' silence
articles.content:
All Korean people observe three minutes' silence
    Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Korea is in profound mourning today, the 5th anniversary of the passing away of the President Kim Il Sung.   At noon all the Korean people observed three minutes' silence in memory of President Kim Il Sung who devoted his all to the prosperity of the country and the happiness of the people for 80 odd years.   Whistles were blown by locomotives and ships and sirens sounded simultaneously throughout the country.   Flags have been at half-mast at institutions, enterprises and other units across the country since July 7.
